questions.question: The first step of the Software Life-Cycle is for:
One of the Incremental development disadvange:
answers: Customers are able to use and gain value from the software earlier than is possible with a waterfall process.
System structure tends to degrade as new increments are added.
Less analysis and documentation required than with the waterfall model.
The cost of accommodating changing customer requirements is reduced.

questions.question: What is true about the Incremental delivery:
answers: Early increments act as a prototype to help elicit requirements for later increments.
Lower risk of overall project failure.
The highest priority system services tend to receive the most testing.

questions.question: why softwar could be fails?
answers: Poor reporting of the project's status.

questions.question: What are the key challenges facing software engineering ?
Essential attributes of good software
answers: Efficiency, Acceptability, security, Dependability, cheap price
cheap price, Supports the customer, Maintainability, security.

questions.question: what is The COCOMO 2 model ?
answers: Based on a standard formula for algorithmic models.
Based on standard estimates of developer productivity in application (object) points/month.
An empirical model based on project experience.
Takes into account black-box code that is reused without change and code that has to be adapted to integrate it with new code.

questions.question: One of the Risks types is risk types, what does it mean?
answers: The time required to develop the software is underestimated.
The rate of defect repair is underestimated.
The size of the software is underestimated.
